text:
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 20
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:15 P. M. Current Questions and Answers, Dept, of Agri¬
cultural Engineering.
2:00 P. M. Music—WEAR Trio.
2:15 P. M. Why Does Silk Wear or Wear Out? Div. of Home
Economics.
2:30 P. M. Michigan State College of the Air—Spanish Les¬
son No. 7, J. O. Swain, Dept, of Modern Lan¬
guages.
3 :00 P. M. Music—Wendell Westcott, Piano.
3:15 P. M. Michigan State College of the Air—Dramatic
Production, C. H. Nickle, Dept, of Speech and
Dramatics.
3:30 P. M. Geography in the News, E. C. Prophet, Dept, of
Geology and Geography.
THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 21
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:15 P. M. Various Feeds Affecting the Flavor of Milk, G.
E. Taylor, Dept, of Dairy Husbandry.
2:00 P. M. Music—Robert Coleman, Piano.
2:15 P. M. Uncle Sam at Your Service.
2:30 P. M. Man and His Environment—The Sons and Daugh¬
ters of Man—1. The Machinery of Heredity,
H. R. Hunt, Dept, of Zoology.
2:45 P. M. Economic Legislation of the 74th Congress—The
Wagner Labor Relations Act, William Haber,
Dept, of Economics.
8 :00 P. M. Music.
3:15 P. M. The Microbe Behind the Pain, H. J. Stafseth,
Dept, of Bacteriology.
3:30 P. M. History in the Making—America, E. B. Lyon,
Dept, of History.
FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 22
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:15 P. M. Garden and Orchard Insects, Dept, of Entomology.
2 :00 P. M. Music.
2:15 P. M. Home Laundering, Div. of Home Economics.
2:30 P. M. Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
3:00 P. M. Music.
3:15 P. M. Adventures Abroad—Farming in Greece, G. J.
Bouyoucos, Dept, of Soils.
3:30 P. M. Spartan Sports in Review, Harry Wismer.
SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 23
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:15 P. M. 4-H Club Program—-Report from Campus Dele¬
gate to American Youth Foundation Camp,
George Bird, 4-H News.
MONDAY, NOVEMBER 25
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:16 P. M. Results of 1935 Variety Trials with White Pea
Beans, E. E. Down, Dept, of Farm Crops.
12:30 P. M. Rural Electrification, L. A. Walkling, Sec’y» Mich¬
igan Rural Electrification Ass’n.
2:00 P. M. Music—Julius Stulberg, Violin, Joe Evans, Piano.
2:16 P. M. The Thanksgiving Dinner, Beatrice Grant, Div.
of Home Economics.
2:30 P. M. Michigan State College of the Air—Psychology
No. 7, J. M. DeHaan, Dept, of Psychology.
8:00 P. M. Music.
8:15 P. M. The Educational Harvest, E. L. Austin, Dept, of
Education.
3:30 P. M. Science News of the Week.
3:45 P. M. News of the Highways, Mott Heath, Michigan
State Highway Dept.
TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 26
12:00 Noon Weather and Market Reports.
12:07 P. M. Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
12:15 P. M. Current Poultry Problems, F. N. Barrett, Dept,
of Poultry Husbandry.
2:00 P. M. Music.
2:15 P. M. Michigan Seed Inspection, Charles Stahl, Michi¬
gan State Dept, of Agriculture.
2:30 P. M. Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
3 :00 P. M. Music—Morris Hochberg, Violin.
